title: University of Nairobi Full Scholarship
description: Full tuition support for high-achieving Kenyan students with financial need. Renewable annually subject to academic performance.
eligibility: Kenyan citizens with KCSE mean grade A- or higher
Admitted to a full-time undergraduate program at the University of Nairobi
howToApply: Complete the online application form on the scholarship portal
Shortlisted candidates will be invited for interviews
documentsRequired: Recommendation letter from a teacher or community leader
Proof of financial need (e.g., guardian income statement)

title: Mastercard Foundation Scholarship
description: Supports academically talented youth—especially from economically marginalized communities—to access quality education.
benefits: Tuition, accommodation, books, and living expenses
howToApply: Follow each partner’s specific application instructions

title: Oxford Africa Graduate Scholarship
description: Funding for outstanding African students pursuing graduate study at the University of Oxford.
eligibility: Ordinarily resident in an African country
Offer to study an eligible Oxford graduate program
benefits: Course fees and a grant for living costs
Access to Oxford’s research facilities and networks
howToApply: Apply for your Oxford course by the relevant deadline
Complete the scholarships section in the course application

title: DAAD EPOS Scholarships
description: Postgraduate courses with special relevance to developing countries.
eligibility: Bachelor’s degree (normally in a related field)
At least two years of professional experience
Motivation to contribute to development-related challenges
benefits: Health, accident and personal liability insurance
howToApply: Apply directly to the eligible EPOS course
Include DAAD application forms and required documents

title: Chevening Scholarships
description: Global scholarship programme that offers future leaders a unique opportunity to study in the UK.
eligibility: Undergraduate degree equivalent to a UK upper second-class 2:1
At least two years’ work experience
Offer from a UK university (by the specified deadline)
benefits: Travel costs to and from the UK
Arrival allowance and homeward departure allowance
howToApply: Apply online via the Chevening application system
Choose three eligible UK Masters courses
Submit references and documents by the deadlines
